name: Artist Residence Brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow if you want something different then stay at the Artist Residence! Stayed for one night in a room with a sea view only 100metres from the sea, great spot for exploring brighton everything is within walking distance. The art work in our room was stunning and the bathroom was exceptional. Breakfast is first class and all the staff that we met were very friendly and helpful; if you want something different than the average bnb or small hotel then stay at the Artists Residence!
reviews.title: Great views deliciously different!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed for 2 nights after spotting the hotel on the internet. We liked the look of the style and the reviews were good. From the moment we arrived at the hotel until the time we left, the staff were cheerful and helpful throughout. The room was great fun and the bathroom was small but modern and the shower was very good. There was little or no noise at night so we slept very well and breakfast was served until a decent time in the morning so no early mornings. The AR big breakfast was excellent, the ingredients of high quality and we didn't feel hungry until well into the afternoon. Brighton is a brilliant place to go, and I would recommend anyone to stay at the Artist Residence for their trip.
reviews.title: Great location, unique style.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. The location is great, a quiet area, about 15 mins walk from the Lanes and the Pier, and just around the corner from the wide selection of restaurants on Preston Street. The hotel itself is, as the name suggests, all about art, and the unique rooms are great fun with colourful murals and fun features. The room we stayed in was a good size, and the bathroom was super funky with a decent shower. There's a few details about the place which prevents it from being up there with the best - our room, although perfectly clean, had a bit of damp on the outside wall and peeling paint - there were also no curtains, just a blind, which the brief early morning sunshine easily managed to penetrate. The staff were nice and friendly though and all in all we had a great time and were more than happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Bit arty, bit quirky, great fun, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I trawled through various hotel and B&B reviews before booking the AR, looking for the perfect spot for our first night away together in a long, long time (we have a 19 mth old...enough said!). We were attracted by it's positioning, the artsy feel, and also by it's many good reviews on several similar sites. I must mention as well that at £50 night (the current special as of April 29 2012) it seemed like a steal - we could have a room with a balcony and incredible ocean views for less than other B&Bs which offered neither.
reviews.title: Quirky, friendly, comfortable, well-positioned, and great value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The A.R. was easy to find, but didn't have any free parking available. For 24 hours we paid just over £12 in the local car park, situated underneath Regency Square. On arrival we were greeted by the loveliest girl (I am so sorry that I never asked her name - she should have been mentioned on here) who gave us all the info we needed and a friendly welcome, but didn't make us feel like me had to sit a chit-chat - we were showed to our room and then left to our own devices. The B&B appeared clean, quirky, and was quietly buzzing with artists working away in the downstairs area, which was an exciting feeling. Usually hotels and B&Bs are still and quiet and you feel as though you have to whisper...not the A.R., as you actually get to see art in progress.
reviews.title: Unique - with view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is in an ideal location,close to the sea and easy to walk to the centre of Brighton.Rooms were bright clean and fun.The beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was wonderful(I loved the scrambled eggs and salmon -the best I have ever had)The staff were very friendly and keen to help,I look forward to returning.
reviews.title: I will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to stay in the Bonnie and Clyde room ( number 4) and we loved the decor. We had a double bed and a single both of which were comfortable. Everything was absolutely spotless and the white linen and towels were pristine.
reviews.title: Very Friendly Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of points to note. There was a slight sewage smell on entering the room ( literally only the room as the hotel was fine ). Unnoticed after a minute or so and after airing the bedroom when we left to go shopping, on our return the smell had dissipated. Don't know where smell was from. Certainly not from bathroom as we checked! Only other couple of points was lack of wardrobe / shelves as no-where to put clothes other than the bedside table. There were hangers on a coat stand but not appropriate for what we had. Fine for a couple a couple of days but any longer and you might struggle for clothes storage. Finally ... Probably a girl thing ... A mirror in the main room would have assisted when drying hair and doing makeup.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon leaving a lovely man ( sorry we didn't take his name but he was from Scotland!) didn't hesitate in carrying our bags to the car which was a lovely gesture. He really seemed to care and chatted to us on a couple of occasions (mostly about the appalling weather we were having!)
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Literally 10 minute walk to pier / shops / theatre etc. We unfortunately didn't have a sea view room but those who do have a lovely view of regency square and the remains of the west pier. Our aim is to visit again and stay in a sea view room!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

description: Artist Residence is a cross between a hotel and art gallery. Our boutique guesthouse is bang in the centre of Brighton. Each of our en-suite hotel rooms have been individually designed by both local and internationally renowned urban artists. Our Hotel is situated at the top of Regency Square in a grade 2 listed townhouse, artist residence has dramatic sea views overlooking the West Pier.Our young team of staff are always "in the know" for all the best places to eat, drink and shop so you will always feel at home. Our fantastic location, 2 minutes walk to Brighton Beach and the West Pier and 10 minutes walk to the North and SouthLaines and Brighton's vibrant night life, also sets us apart and places our hotel right in the middle of everything Brighton has to offer.Artist Residence Hotel also holds monthly exhibitions in its on-site gallery displaying works from the Residency Artist.We are not just a bed but an idea, having recently been featured in The Saturday Times Cool Hotel Guide.
